clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Gabapentin on Idiopathic Subjective Tinnitus
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 2 Effect of Gabapentin on Idiopathic Subjective Tinnitus

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine wether Gabapentin which is useful for treating neuropathic pains, is effective on idiopathic subjective tinnitus.

detailed_description.textblock:
Tinnitus is the perception of sound in the absence of acoustic stimulation. It can be subjective or objective. .
Despite numerous researches,no effective treatment for people who suffer from tinnitus has yet been stablished.
As there are many evidences suggesting that loss of inhibition in the central nervous system may be responsible for many aspects of auditory dysfunction,including tinnitus; and as Gabapentin (Neurontin), a gama-aminobutyric acid (GABA) analogue, is an effective medication in conditions where inhibition in the CNS is impaired; we guess that Gabapentin might be useful for treating idiopathic subjective tinnitus.

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction in the sensation of Tinnitus by the patient or complete resolution of tinnitus;by the patient's scoring it from one to ten, before and after prescribing Gabapentin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relieve of complications of tinnitus, such as sleep difficulties.

arm_group.description: Randomly,half of the subjects are given Gabapentin.
Randomly,half of the subjects receive placebo.

intervention.description: Gabapentin, 600 mg bid for the first two weeks, increased to a maximum dose of 1800 mg per day during the next 6 weeks if necessary.
placebo is given with the same definition as Gabapentin

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with subjective idiopathic tinnitus
Exclusion Criteria:
- tinnitus with known underlying cause
- pregnant women and patients younger than 18 or older than 75 years
- patients with impaired renal function
